sentences.english: Everybody was happy and very exciting. It was very lively.
sentences.chinese: 每個人都異常的興奮，歡舞雀躍。

sentences.english: Nu Wa side cheering them for a while, slowly got separated.
sentences.chinese: 他們在女媧身旁歡呼雀躍了一陣，慢慢走散了。

sentences.english: I'm jumpin' in my ride, I'm heading out tonight.
sentences.chinese: 我在我的坐騎上雀躍，今夜我將啓程。

sentences.english: They ooh and aah when the thousands of little lights in the ball come on.
sentences.chinese: 當球上的數千盞小燈亮起時，人羣一陣歡呼雀躍。

sentences.english: Riders sliding smoothly to the bottom jumped with joy.
sentences.chinese: 能夠順利滑到底部的人都雀躍不已。

sentences.english: She was thrilled with the extra bonus.
sentences.chinese: 她爲額外的獎金而雀躍不已。

sentences.english: They cheered when the result was announced.
sentences.chinese: 投票結果公佈後，她們歡呼雀躍。

sentences.english: The team whooped it up after winning the game.
sentences.chinese: 該隊在比賽獲勝後歡呼雀躍。

sentences.english: They cheered and cheered. The hall seemed boiling.
sentences.chinese: 他們歡呼雀躍，大廳裏像開鍋了似的。

sentences.english: We exulted in the school team's victory.
sentences.chinese: 我們爲校隊的勝利歡呼雀躍。

sentences.english: The students enjoy very good time with Korfball.
sentences.chinese: 同學們十分雀躍地享受合球。

sentences.english: These questions were not intrusive, so I answered happily.
sentences.chinese: 這些問題並沒有侵犯性，於是我都雀躍的回答了。

sentences.english: NO02,3. I am overjoyed by that good news. (I was overjoyed to hear the good news. )
sentences.chinese: 聽到那件好消息，我真是雀躍不已。

sentences.english: Into the starlight, rushing in spray, happy at midnight, happy by day.
sentences.chinese: 月光下，急濺起泡沫，午夜裏歡樂，白天裏雀躍。

sentences.english: My hair no longer bounds to my foot's glee.
sentences.chinese: 雀躍，也不再象姑娘們，在鬢髮間。

definition: to move emotionally/to stir up (emotions)/to excite
to be amazed/to be surprised/to wonder
to love sth too much to part with it (idiom); to fondle admiringly
to be startled/to be shocked/to be amazed
happy and excited (idiom)/in high spirits/in great delight
eyes brimming with tears of excitement (idiom)/extremely moved
singing voice/fig. original voice of a poet
